page.title: 16Local History: Early
page.content: Iron Age settlements were found on the meadows at Farmoor when the reservoirs were being constructed. There are no traces of Roman settlements in the area. In Saxon times a "vill" was established on the ridge at Cumnor where there was drinking water and natural defence. It was at this period that lands in the area were given to the Benedictine Abbey of Abingdon, of which Cumnor subsequently became a grange. It is thought that Cumnor Place, built by the Abbey was a country residence, perhaps a convalescent home, for the monks. Two Abbots are buried in Cumnor Church. At the dissolution of the monasteries the last Abbot of Abingdon became Vicar of Cumnor.
